item.title: Static Linked List - Another Way To Represent Graphs
item.author: Author
item.description: Static Linked List is a data structure that stores linked list in static arrays. It is usually used to represent graphs. It is very interesting that its Chinese name literally translated as “Linked Forward Star”. You have two choices of paths to understand this. Start from Forward Star. Start from Adjacency List. However, I would recommend to explore both ideas to have a better understanding.

item.title: Binary Tree
item.author: Author
item.description: Binary tree is called so because of its shape. It’s like a tree, it have leaves and a root. In computer science, the “tree” is usually upside down, the root at the top and leaves grow below it. It is binary so it every node only can have 0, 1 or 2 leaves. Terminologies Leaf Node The node do NOT have any child nodes. Inner Node The Node between the leaf node and the root.

item.title: Stack, Queue and Linked Lists
item.author: Author
item.description: Stack, queue and Linked lists are basic data structures. They appear in our daily life. For example, stacks of intermodal containers at the port, waiting in line(queue) to ride a roller coaster and the film The Human Centipedeï¼Œif you know it. Stack Intro Stack is like a stack of intermodal containers, or a stack of book. Every time you want to put a new item, you put above the original stack, not between or below.
